news_header: Land ownership remains a contentious issue in South Africa, with most farmland still owned by white individuals decades after apartheid. The Democratic Alliance has launched a court bid against new land reform laws, claiming they violate the Constitution. Tensions have escalated with the US, as President Trump froze aid to South Africa over these developments, influenced by Elon Musk's comments on land ownership.
news_original_title: Listicle: The aftermath of South Africa's land reforms
news_text: The South African government disputes claims about the Expropriation Act, stating it is not a land seizure law. Trump's proposal to accept Afrikaner refugees has sparked significant interest, but many in South Africa wish to remain and seek support domestically. The diplomatic situation worsened when US Secretary of State Rubio announced he would skip G20 talks in South Africa, citing an 'anti-American' agenda.
